definition: to prick/to run or stick (a needle etc) into/jug (a classifier for liquids such as beer)
to tie/to bind/classifier for flowers, banknotes etc: bundle/Taiwan pr. [zha2]

sentences.english: Im going to put needles into certain points on your body.
sentences.chinese: 我把针扎到您身上的穴位中去。

sentences.english: Wait until a mosquito imbibe enough blood then punch a hole on its stomach by a needle.
sentences.chinese: 期望一只蚊子吸饱了血，在它肚子上用针扎一个洞。

sentences.english: Feel like pins and needles, it was so cold.
sentences.chinese: 觉得像被针扎，那泪是如此的冰凉。

sentences.english: I jumped as if a pin had been stuck into me.
sentences.chinese: 我跳了起来，好像针扎了我一下。

sentences.english: The gibe smarted in his brain.
sentences.chinese: 人家的嘲笑令他脑子针扎似地作痛。

sentences.english: The needle left a prick in the tailor's finger.
sentences.chinese: 裁缝的手指上有个针扎的孔。

sentences.english: Garrett Breedlove: Id rather stick needles in my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿自己的眼睛被针扎着。

sentences.english: I'm going to put needles into certin points on your body.
sentences.chinese: 我把针扎到您身上的穴位中去。

sentences.english: No. For the blood test, they cut my finger.
sentences.chinese: 不，验血他们要用针扎我的手指头。

sentences.english: He tried to needle me into losing my temper.
sentences.chinese: 他试图用针扎我来激怒我。

sentences.english: She jabbed the shot quickly and precisely, like a pro.
sentences.chinese: 她迅速并精确地把针扎了进去，像一个能手一样。

sentences.english: You know, I know I sound like a broken record.
sentences.chinese: 我跳了起来，好像针扎了我一下。

definition: to prick with a needle/to treat by acupuncture
to sneak in/to infiltrate/to be piercingly painful/to be unbearable (of pain, itch etc)
to give or have an acupuncture treatment
to throb with pain/throbbing pain/twang/pang/CL:陣|阵[zhen4]
stab of pain/sting/fig. stimulus to action/a prick
pit of the stomach/solar plexus/words and thoughts
restless with anxiety/unbearably hot and anxious
to ache/to be sore/to feel painful
